    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static long getMaxPacketsPerSecond​()
      Returns how many packets can be received in the span of a single second (1000 milliseconds) before a session is blocked.
      static void setMaxPacketsPerSecond​(long maxPacketsPerSecond)
      Sets how many packets can be received in the span of a single second (1000 milliseconds) before a session is blocked.
      static void setMaxPacketsPerSecondUnlimited​()
      Removes the max packets per second limit so that no matter how many packets a session sends it will never be blocked.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxPacketsPerSecond

        public static long getMaxPacketsPerSecond​()
        Returns how many packets can be received in the span of a single second (1000 milliseconds) before a session is blocked.
        Returns:
        how many packets can be received in the span of a single second before a session is blocked.

      • setMaxPacketsPerSecond

        public static void setMaxPacketsPerSecond​(long maxPacketsPerSecond)
        Sets how many packets can be received in the span of a single second (1000 milliseconds) before a session is blocked.
        Parameters:
        maxPacketsPerSecond - how many packets can be received in the span of a single second before a session is blocked.

      • setMaxPacketsPerSecondUnlimited

        public static void setMaxPacketsPerSecondUnlimited​()
        Removes the max packets per second limit so that no matter how many packets a session sends it will never be blocked. This is unrecommended, as it can open your server to DOS/DDOS attacks.
